description: The theme generation and storage area
name: tealdoc-cli.theme

description: Create the CSS stylesheet for all the themes
name: tealdoc-cli.theme.createCSS

description: The generated CSS, this can be re-generated if needed
name: tealdoc-cli.theme.css

description: Check if the token kind is a plain-text token or not
name: tealdoc-cli.theme.isNonText

description: All the currently loaded themes
name: tealdoc-cli.theme.themes

description: All registered commands
name: tealdoc-cli.command.commands

description: Load all created commands into the `argparse.Parser` instance
name: tealdoc-cli.command.load

description: Run a command
name: tealdoc-cli.command.run

description: Register a new command using the `Command` object
name: tealdoc-cli.command.register

description: The structure of all commands
name: tealdoc-cli.command.Command

description: Combination of luafilesystem and io
name: tealdoc-cli.fs

description: A factory used to generate a function that converts types into strings
name: tealdoc-cli.humanize

description: Logger for debugging and logging
name: tealdoc.logger

description: Send an error level message
name: tealdoc.logger.error

description: The current level of the logger
name: tealdoc.logger.level

description: Get the traceback where all build-file paths are replaced with source-file paths
name: tealdoc.logger.trace

description: Create a log message, the level must be a number between 1 and 5
name: tealdoc.logger.log

description:
Send a debug message

The debug message will be inspected and colorized to aid in debugging (both `inspect.lua` and `pl.lexer` must be installed)
name: tealdoc.logger.debug

description: If there should be color in the output
name: tealdoc.logger.color

description: Send a warning level message
name: tealdoc.logger.warn

description: Send an informational message
name: tealdoc.logger.info

description: Utilities for extracting all the types from either virtual files or real files
name: tealdoc.parser

description: The types that form this type, eg `type1 | type2` or `{type1, type2}`
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.types

description: The name of the type, usually inherited from their parent
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.name

description: The value of the table
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.value

description: The source of where the type was found
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.source

description: The Y position of a type
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.yPos

description: A list of all valid type names
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.Kinds

description: The parent of the type, this doesn't exist for top-level types
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.parent

description: If the type is hidden or not
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.hidden

description: The file-system tree that needs to be followed
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.tree

description: The kind of type this is
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.kind

description: Exists on function types
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.func

description: The key of the table
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.key

description: The custom name of a type
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.customName

description: Signify that a type has been deprecated
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.deprecated

description: The description of the type, every type can have a description since of records
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.description

description: The stopping point of a type
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.stopY

description: The values of an enum, its separate from types due to enums being "complex" aka blocked
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.values

description: Either a record or a module
name: tealdoc.parser.Type.struct

description: The tag api to allow certain pieces of text to modify a type
name: tealdoc.tag

description: All the supported rules
name: tealdoc.tag.rules

description: If any of the passed rules pass, return true
name: tealdoc.tag.rules.any

description: Require the type be a certain kind
name: tealdoc.tag.rules.kind

description: Assert that the parent of a type must be a certain kind
name: tealdoc.tag.rules.parentMustBe

description: Wildcard
name: tealdoc.tag.rules.anyKind

description: The configuration all tags have
name: tealdoc.tag.TagConfig

description: The callback function
name: tealdoc.tag.TagConfig.fn

description: The Lua pattern to match by
name: tealdoc.tag.TagConfig.selector

description: The types that are allowed, this comes from `tealdoc.tag.rules`
name: tealdoc.tag.TagConfig.allowed

description: An error message if `allowed` fails
name: tealdoc.tag.TagConfig.err

description: Traverse the module tree in search of descriptions
name: tealdoc.tag.traverse

description: Things used in templates that are not large enough for their own file
name: tealdoc-cli.misc

description: Get the root of the documentation output
name: tealdoc-cli.misc.toRoot

description: The tippy configuration used
name: tealdoc-cli.misc.tippy

description: The order in which module contents are sorted
name: tealdoc-cli.misc.order
